CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant and her family lived and worked in LOC in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was taken to a hospital in the town of GPE . According to the applicant , local doctors failed to diagnose her correctly and provide adequate treatment ; as a result her health was seriously damaged .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant brought a medical malpractice suit against the municipal health protection institution “ FAC ” ( муниципальное учреждение здравоохранения « NORP центральная районная больница ORG ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the Chukotka Region allowed the applicant 's action and awarded her RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . The judgment was not appealed against and on DATE it became final and enforceable .
CARDINAL . After the hospital had failed to pay the judgment debt for DATE the applicant sent complaints to the President of GPE , the Minister of Health , ORG and other authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chukotka Regional Department of ORG ( in charge of the court bailiffs ) advised the applicant as follows :

“ ... it was established that the debtor had no cash funds in its accounts . According to its founding documents , the debtor is an institution and , pursuant to LAW , an institution is only liable to the extent of its cash funds . LAW provides that an institution may not alienate or otherwise dispose of the property attached to it or of the property acquired at the expense [ of its owner ] .

In accordance with Information Letter no . CARDINAL of the Presidium of ORG of GPE of DATE On the recovery out of the property of an institution ' , if the debtor , who is an institution , lacks cash funds , then recovery is not possible out of the other property assigned to the institution by its owner ... ”

CARDINAL . ORG further informed the applicant that the enforcement proceedings had been closed on DATE because the enforcement had been impossible , but it was open for the applicant to initiate the enforcement proceedings again .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chukotka ORG of ORG forwarded the applicant 's complaint to the chief court bailiff of LOC , for enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Chukotka ORG of ORG responded to the applicant and gave the same explanation as in the letter of DATE . It also added that in respect of the hospital there were several other enforcement proceedings having the first and second rank , whilst the applicant 's claim only had the fifth rank .
CARDINAL . On DATE a court bailiff confirmed again that the hospital had no cash funds and that the recovery could not be made out of its property .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff required the FAC clearing centre to seize the cash funds of the hospital .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff determined that the enforcement was not possible due to the debtor 's lack of funds . The enforcement proceedings were definitively closed and the writ of execution was returned to the applicant .
